questions.question_hindi: मलिक काफ़ूरको हज़ार दीनारी कहा गया था, क्योंकि-
options_hindi: उसके पास 1000 गाँवों का स्वामित्व था।
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: Malik Kafur was called Hazar Dinari because-
options_english: He was the leader of 1000 soldiers.
He gave 1000 dinars in charity daily.
questions.explanation_english: Malik Kafur was a prominent general and administrator during the Delhi Sultanate under Alauddin Khilji. He was known as 'Hazar Dinari' (Thousand Dinars) because he distributed 1000 dinars daily in charity to the poor and needy. This act of generosity earned him the title and highlighted his role in promoting social welfare under the sultanate.
questions.explanation_hindi: मलिक काफूर दिल्ली सल्तनत के शासक अलाउद्दीन खिलजी के शासनकाल में एक प्रमुख सेनापति और प्रशासक थे। उन्हें 'हजार दीनारी' कहा जाता था क्योंकि वे गरीब और जरूरतमंद लोगों को प्रतिदिन 1000 दीनार दान करते थे। यह दान उदारता का प्रतीक था और इसी कारण वे इस उपनाम से जाने गए।
key_facts: Malik Kafur was a trusted general of Alauddin Khilji and played a key role in expanding the Delhi Sultanate's territory.
His title 'Hazar Dinari' reflects his charitable contributions, emphasizing the sultanate's focus on social welfare.

questions.question_hindi: हड़प्पावासियों को निम्नलिखित में से किसका ज्ञान नहीं था?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: Which of the following was not known to the Harappans?
questions.explanation_english: The Harappans (Indus Valley Civilization) were known for their advanced urban planning, including sophisticated drainage systems, construction of wells, and use of pillars in their buildings. However, there is no evidence to suggest they used true arches in their architecture. While they employed corbelled arches (a technique where stones are gradually overlapped to form a structure), true arches (using a keystone) were not part of their construction techniques. This distinction makes option (d) the correct answer.
questions.explanation_hindi: हड़प्पा लोग (सिंधु घाटी सभ्यता) अपनी उन्नत शहरी योजना के लिए जाने जाते थे, जिसमें जटिल नाली प्रणाली, कुओं का निर्माण और खम्भों का उपयोग शामिल था। हालांकि, उनकी वास्तुकला में मेहराबों (सच्चे आर्च) का उपयोग होने का कोई सबूत नहीं है। वे कोर्बेल्ड आर्च (जहां पत्थरों को धीरे-धीरे एक दूसरे पर ओवरलैप करके निर्माण किया जाता है) का उपयोग करते थे, लेकिन सच्चे मेहराबों (जिनमें कीस्टोन का उपयोग होता है) का निर्माण उनकी तकनीक में शामिल नहीं था। यह अंतर विकल्प (द) को सही बनाता है।
key_facts: Harappans had advanced drainage systems and wells.
True arches (using a keystone) were not part of Harappan architecture.

questions.question_hindi: निम्न में से किस व्यक्ति को ‘बिना ताज का बादशाह’ कहा जाता है?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: Which of the following individuals is known as the 'King without a Crown'?
questions.explanation_english: Bal Gangadhar Tilak was a prominent leader of the Indian independence movement and was often referred to as the 'King without a Crown' due to his strong leadership and charismatic personality. He was known for his aggressive and assertive approach to achieving self-rule, which earned him this title. Tilak played a crucial role in mobilizing the masses and was a key figure in the Indian National Congress. His leadership style and influence over the freedom struggle made him a symbol of authority and resistance against British rule.
questions.explanation_hindi: बाल गंगाधर तिलक भारतीय स्वतंत्रता आंदोलन के प्रमुख नेता थे और उन्हें 'बिना ताज का बादशाह' कहा जाता था। उनकी मजबूत नेतृत्व शैली और चारित्रिक शक्ति के कारण यह उपनाम दिया गया। तिलक आगे और संघर्षपूर्ण तरीके से स्वतंत्रता के लिए लड़ाई लड़े। वे भारतीय राष्ट्रीय कांग्रेस के महत्वपूर्ण नेता थे और जनता को संगठित करने में उनकी भूमिका अहम रही। उनके नेतृत्व के कारण वे ब्रिटिश शासन के खिलाफ प्रतिरोध के प्रतीक बन गए।
key_facts: Bal Gangadhar Tilak was a key leader of the Indian National Congress and a prominent figure in the Indian independence movement.
The title 'King without a Crown' highlights his authoritative leadership and influence during the freedom struggle.

questions.question_hindi: हड़प्पाकाल मेंताँबेके रथ की खोज किस स्थान से हुई थी?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: In which site was the discovery of a copper chariot made during the Harappan period?
questions.explanation_english: The discovery of a copper chariot from the Harappan period was made at Rakhigarhi, a significant archaeological site in Haryana. This find highlights the advanced metallurgical skills and technological capabilities of the Harappan civilization. Rakhigarhi is one of the largest Harappan sites and has yielded several important artifacts, including the copper chariot, which provides insights into their craftsmanship and transportation methods.
questions.explanation_hindi: हड़प्पाकाल में ताँबे के रथ की खोज हरियाणा के राखीगढ़ी स्थल से की गई थी। यह पाया गया कि हड़प्पा सभ्यता के लोग धातुकर्म और प्रौद्योगिकी में उन्नत थे। राखीगढ़ी हड़प्पा सभ्यता का सबसे बड़ा स्थल है और यहाँ से कई महत्वपूर्ण वस्तुएँ मिली हैं, जिनमें ताँबे का रथ शामिल है। यह खोज हमें उनके कारीगरी और परिवहन विधियों के बारे में जानकारी देती है।
key_facts: Rakhigarhi is located in Haryana and is one of the largest Harappan sites.
The copper chariot discovery at Rakhigarhi (2017) showcases the metallurgical expertise of the Harappan civilization.

questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: When was Mahavir Swami called a 'Yati'?
questions.explanation_english: Mahavir Swami, the 24th Tirthankara of Jainism, was called a 'Yati' (ascetic) after renouncing his worldly life and leaving his home. The term 'Yati' refers to a Jain monk who has taken vows of renunciation and detachment from material possessions. This title is specifically associated with the act of abandoning household life to pursue spiritual discipline.
questions.explanation_hindi: महावीर स्वामी, जैन धर्म के 24वें तीर्थंकर, को 'यती' कहा गया था जब उन्होंने घर छोड़कर विश्वास और धर्म के प्रति अपनी प्रतिबद्धता को अपनाया। 'यती' शब्द एक जैन मुनि को चिह्नित करता है जो दुनिया की वस्तुओं से दूर रहकर आध्यात्मिक जीवन जीता है। यह घर छोड़ने के बाद दिया गया शीर्षक है।
key_facts: Mahavir Swami became a 'Yati' after renouncing his household life.
The term 'Yati' is specific to Jain ascetics who have taken vows of renunciation.
